interlinear-text.item: ELA The Story of Toshkhon and Gulqurbon

phrase.item: Once, there were [two lovers named] Toshkhon and Gulqurbon. I will tell you the story shortly.
So they were both born [at the same time] in two different cities.
Gulqurbon's parents also had two daughters [?]
Toshkhon was born so extremely handsome that the reflection of his face would go right into the wall.
His parents built forty houses, each one inside another, and put him there.
Meanwhile, a girl was born as well [Gulqurbon].
Then they arranged for that girl, when she would grow up, to marry their son.
They built him forty rooms, one inside of another, and around him they made a big garden full of flowers.
He was kept inside that place.
Later, when he grew up, he said, "Take me out of here."
One day Gulqurbon saw [Toshkhon] in her dream, and he saw [Gulqurbon] in his dream.
He and Gulqurbon were in different cities.
Then one day his parents said to him, "You need to marry.
Our beloved Toshkhon, when you were born, at the same time a girl was born."
‎‎He refused.
Both he and his parents were upset.
So he left the place where he was and went to the city where Gulqurbon was.
Thirty- two friends of his left with him.
Together they built a boat.
When they got into the boat, his sister also went with them.
She said, "I should go to ensure that by some chance my brother is not killed."
And she started singing: "Oh Toshkhon's kurta [shirt] is so long. He walks so gracefully. May I become your Gulqurbon, Oh, flower may I become your buyer..."
But he didn't even turn around or look back.

Suddenly his mother came out [before they left], singing, "Oh Toshkhon's kurta is so blue, so blue. Oh your mother was such an unbeliever, like a blue stone. May I become your Gulqurbon Oh, flower may I become your buyer..."
Again, he didn't glance or look back.
Then the [first] girl who had been betrothed to him [and rejected], she came to him.
And she said, "Toshkhon's caravan has 32 people.
May Toshkhon's boat" -- she started cursing him -- "sink in the river".
But he and his friends happily crossed the river and reached the other side. They rested there for a while and then went to the city where Gulqurbon lived.
When they reached there, they went to an old woman's house.
That old woman had a sheep and a lamb.
That woman was assigned to wash Gulqurbon's head [hair].
[Toshkhon] said, "Oh mother of my fate, can you allow us to stay at your place for a few days?"
She replied, "Oh, son of my fate, I am lonely. I have only one sheep, a lamb and a small cauldron.
I make [in the cauldron] a soup [from flour], I would drink it and can barely feed my lamb."
He said, "Oh, mother of my fate, it's okay, we will stay at your house."
So, they stayed over and at night she made them that [flour] soup.
Then the soup was distributed to all 32 people and it made them full.
She also drank the soup and was full.
Both the sheep and lamb were also sated and they even left some over.
Surprised, she said, "O creator of the world, what is this mystery?
This wasn't even enough for me or my sheep.
But this time it was enough for the whole caravan."
That was the creator's mystery.
Then she set up the bed for them and they slept. Next day in the morning... every morning the woman would take hot water to Gulgurbon for her face .
[Toshkhon] asked her, "Oh mother of my fate, where are you going?"
She responded, "I am taking water to Gulqurbon..." ‎‎He said, "Can I have the water for a minute?"
She handed him the [jar] and he dropped his picture inside it.
She took the water to [Gulqurbon] who looked down into it. Well, they had seen each other in dreams.
Then she saw Toshkhon's picture
and she asked, "Who is in your house?"
And [the old woman] replied, "Oh, daughter of my fate, who would come to my place? Nobody is at my home.
I am alone."
And [Gulqurbon] said, "Mother, make some warm water and I will come wash my head."
The [old lady] made the water ready and she came over. But at the very moment when she and Toshkhon met, they both lost consciousness.
Then they sat together for a while and
finally he said, "So I have seen you in my dreams." And she replied, "Me too..." Then he said: "I came to marry you".
She replied: "I doubt that my father would agree."
"Maybe he will agree," he said, and left.
Then she returned home. Some part of the story I have forgotten.
"Okay, try," she told him, and left. He also went and camped opposite Gulqurbon's father house.
[Gulqurbon] asked her servant, ‎‎"What is that?
And who is there?"
[Gulqurbon's father] said, "Why did he camp opposite my house?"
The [servant] came and asked him
and [Toshkhon] replied, "I am Gulqurbon's lover."
I am going to marry Gulqurbon. Tell this to her father."
He went and told her father.
‎‎Her father said, "What kind of person is he?
I won't let my daughter [do this]."
Later, he checked that [Toshkhon] was not moving [from where he was camped],
so he came to check for himself and he saw Toshkhon. Toshkhon was so handsome that it could be surprising.
So then [the father] agreed
and said, "It's okay, I allow my daughter to marry you."
And [Toshkhon] replied, "Okay, Gulqurbon and I will make a wedding."
They had a wedding that lasted several days.
He stayed there, but as for his 32 caravans [his friends], he gave them many gifts and sent them back.
They left and the couple lived there for a while. But then suddenly, he missed his parents and grew sad.
She asked him, "What happened to you?"
And he replied, "I miss my parents."
[The father] said, "It's fine, you guys can go.
Now you two are wife and husband, you can live anywhere you want."
Then [her family] made all food and snacks ready for them, and they left [for Toshkhon's city].
His parents saw him in their dreams every night and especially that night.
The [mother] saw him in her dream and asked her daughter, "Oh children, did you see anything in your dream?
I saw Toshkhon, I miss my son." The father told the mother, "She is doing her usual annoying thing, too much...".
She started singing -- "I saw in my dream that Toshkhon is dead." ([Toshkhon and Gulqurbon at this time] were on the roof and were looking down through the chimney.)
-- "Crows took away Toshkhon's eyes.
Oh, may I become your Gulqurbon.
Oh flower, may I become your buyer..."
His father lost consciousness and fell on the floor, and his mother fell in the space in front of the tandoor oven.
The youngest sister said, "How unlucky, you killed them..."

and she rubbed her [mother's] face and sing, "I saw in my dream that Toshkhon had come." (He was watching from the roof at this point as she sang.) "Toshkhon has came with all his goods. Oh, may I become your Gulqurbon, Oh, flower may I become your buyer."

And so Toshkhon and Gulqurbon ran around and entered through the door, and the boy rubbed his father's face and the father turned into a 14-year-old boy, and Gulqurbon rubbed her mother-in-law's face and the mother-in-law turned into a 14-year-old girl.
And that's the end of the story!
